text: I am sure that if the mothers of various nations could meet, there would be no more wars.
author: E. M. Forster

text: When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.
author: Sophia Loren

text: Yes, Mother. I can see you are flawed. You have not hidden it. That is your greatest gift to me.
author: Alice Walker

text: Sweater, n.: garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Who in their infinite wisdom decreed that Little League uniforms be white? Certainly not a mother.
author: Erma Bombeck
